review.reviewBody: Love this bag! (It's replacing my old REI seat bag of 20+ years; held together with duct tape, tied to seat rails w/ packing cord.)  Fits two tubes and small patch kit in main compartment, and small multitool and two tyre levers in the side compartment (product details accurate!)  (I prefer my old Topeak Road pump to CO2 cartridges; no trash and infinite pumps!)  LOVE the Hypalon strap with the BOA® Closure System; WAY better than velcro. It securely and snuggly attaches to seat rails with ZERO movement. So well made it should last another 20+ years! Also bought the Hypalon EDC Strap with BOA Closure to attach pump to it btwn the seat rails as you can see in the pics; works perfectly!!! LOVE MY NEW SET UP!!!
review.name: Sweet As Silca!

review.reviewBody: I have the smaller version of this bag that I use for my road bike, and it (the smaller version) is perfect for a tube, small multi-tool, and C02 cartridge. I bought the bigger one thinking that it would be perfect for my mountain bike and would accommodate a larger tube, multi-tool, C02, etc.  Unfortunately, the bag is TOO BIG!  When my dropper seat post is in its lowest position, and my bike shock is compressed (landing a jump), the saddle bag makes contact and rubs against the rear tire.  The issue could be unique to my bike and the smaller version of this bag doesn't have the same issue.  After one trip to Deer Valley, my rear tire had rubbed the bag so much that it ruined the threads around the bag's zipper.  Otherwise, the bag is great!  Weatherproof.  Can hold a ton of crap.  Boa system is great.
review.name: BIG!

name: Mattone Grande Pack

description: Buy the Lib Technologies Lost Retro Ripper Snowboard - 2024 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lost Retro Ripper Snowboard - 2024
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lib Technologies Lost Retro Ripper Snowboard - 2024 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Paid for two business day delivery for a coming trip, still not getting the board on 4th business day.
review.name: Not happy about the shipment

review.reviewBody: I was in Japan in March and demoed this board and quickly fell in love. It is considered a powder board, but the conditions I rode there were all mountain even some ice and this did it all and didn’t skip a beat. I have rode roughly 10 boards in the last 6+ years and I have never felt more confident on a board till now. I just kept pushing the board faster and it was like a NASCAR in the turns, it just did exactly what I told it to do. Floated supremely in powder and then on groomers. It was very turny and playful being full camber, but had plenty of edge control that I never wanted to go back to my all mountain board. I ordered this board while in Japan and I’ve now ride it stateside in Oregon four times and every time I love the board even more. I’m 5’10”, 200 lbs, being a 156 when I demoed, I was unsure if I should go up a size, but I feel very confident in this size board.
review.name: most fun I’ve had on the snow !

name: Lost Retro Ripper Snowboard - 2024

review.reviewBody:
The pros:
They do keep your feet warm and are pretty comfortable (other than the con below). I bought these last fall and have not experienced what others have been saying about the boot digging into my ankles. I rarely wear short socks with these though so that may make a difference?

The cons:
They are very heavy and almost a little difficult to walk in because of that fact. 

I bought an 8 (normally between a 7.5-8 depending on the shoe) and they do fit fine with normal thickness socks on. They are snuck if I put on thicker socks. Although I do like these boots and will not be getting rid of them, I will be trying to find something lighter for regular use in the winter

review.reviewBody:
I will prefix by saying that I had the previous version for over 7 years, with 4 years of extensive usage across Patagonia (70+ mph winds), Hawaii, Peru, Chile, Argentina, Colorado, and California. It performed impeccably, remaining in perfect condition the entire time. The tent was reliable in rain, winds, snow, and light and packable enough to go backpacking. Unfortunately, I was quite upset when it was caught in a car hitch and got a huge tear across the mesh, so I decided to purchase the new version, hoping it would be just as good.

Fast forward to last weekend, when we took out the tent for the first time on a warmup backpacking trip in Colorado. Initially, it felt similar enough in quality, though I wasn't sure how much I liked the asymmetrical sides, with the addition of the wings. The first night went quite smoothly, but by the second night, we noticed issues we never encountered with the older version. First, there were already stress marks on the tent mesh. While this wasn't a major issue, it was concerning. More significantly, we noticed that this tent version is not as sturdy as the previous version, when mear 20-30mph winds flattened our tent (no damage to the poles, though the creaking sounds were not reassuring), and created a tear in the rain cover. 

The last thing I wanted to mention, is the downgrade on the zipper quality. The previous version had smooth, easy-gliding zippers. In contrary, the zippers on the new version tended to get stuck more frequently.

Despite these issues, I am still giving it a 2/5 since it might provide enough value to be an OK car camping tent, but it certainly disappointed us coming from the previous version.
review.name: Major quality downgrade from previous version

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just what I was looking for. First two times it was used got decent rain and it stayed perfectly dry. Had very strong winds that collapsed one side (while nobody was in it and I don’t have it tied down, just staked) and it popped right back up when the wind stopped. No damage. The “wings” make it a little more difficult to set up with a good tight stretch on all sides, but I do love that extra space inside.
review.name: Great Quality, Great Space

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Has handled 4 trips to the BWCA and is still in new condition.
review.name: Great tent

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Let me first state that I have purchased nothing but Marmot tents for the past ten years. I had both the 2 and 3 man versions of the previous limelight design. Both tents were great, 5-star tents in durability, waterproofness, easy to set up, etc. My 3 man limelight even provided shelter for my dog in I during a small, confirmed EF-1 tornado (true story) and came out the backend with only a small crack in one section of a tent pole. Granted I was set up between 2 RV's, which certainly helped protect us, and it only lasted about 10 seconds, but the tornado ripped the entire roof off of the adjacent barn (dropping it 75 feet away from my tent) and moved one of the 2 RV's a few feet to the side. After that, I swore that I would never purchase anything other than a Marmot tent.

Fast forward a few years and that same tent ended up being run-over by another RV while the guy was backing up (luckily nobody inside) so it was time to purchase a new one. I noticed they had changed the design in order to incorporate part of the vestibule inside the body, which seemed like a good idea. However, the door opens from the wrong side in order to exit the tent. If you want to exit, you have to open the door all the way in order to reach the zipper on the rain fly, and if you don't roll it up, it can dangle onto the wet and muddy ground inside the vestibule area. This, in turn, leads to other problems including filty white mesh in the door (any white on camping gear is just a bad idea) that's impossible to get as clean as you would like, and dirty doorway zipper, which has already broken after only around 10 days since new. Who honestly rolls up their door and secures it every single time they enter and exit the tent? Well, if you don't, you pay for it quickly.

Out of the box, the rain fly also wetted out, causing it to cling to the body of the tent, which then caused water to enter the tent in the seam between the floor and side wall. I have since remedied this problem with seam sealant and using a lot of waterproofing spray on the rain fly, but I would have thought it would have repelled rain right out of the box. My previous Marmot tents did. But when the rain rolls down the rain fly and hits the ground, it bounces back up under the rain fly, and even after spraying it twice, the fabric in the tent body still has a tendency to wet out and allow that moisture inside. 

Hopefully Marmot can address these issues (I saw someone else bring up the door problem) and get this model back up to snuff with its predecessors. Until then, and it pains me to say this after my previous high-quality Marmot purchases. I can't recommend this tent as it stands currently.
review.name: Average with a flaw

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] To provide context for this review, I routinely live out of a tent for weeks at a time in remote sites at high latitudes in North America and Asia.  Weather extremes, especially gale-force wind and rain, occur often enough that any tent I use needs to be able to handle such conditions without risk of collapse or allowing water inside.  Biting insects are also a common concern, so tents need to allow exit/entry to take place through the smallest possible opening in the door, in as brief a time as possible, ideally with the fly only partially unzipped.  I am not climbing mountains, so an expedition-grade mountaineering tent is not necessary, nor am I backpacking, so I am not concerned about going with an ultra-light option (though lighter is generally better, of course).  

Recently my two go-to field tents gave up the ghost in rapid succession, which sent me on the hunt for a new one.  I’ve not been especially happy with the “standard model” that has become the norm for 2 and 3 person camping/backpacking tents – a “spider” made of 4 legs and a single ridge pole, and a separate short pole that holds the sides of the tent as well as the full coverage fly out from the ridge pole.  That design is great for providing vestibule space, a roomy interior, and decent protection from rain.  It is not so great, in my experience, in high wind situations.  The single ridge pole simply doesn’t have much to brace against, so the spider flexes and flattens.  With that in mind, I went on the hunt for something new.  

I liked the look of the Limelight for several reasons.  Rather than the above-mentioned spider, it has a pair of poles that crisscross over the tent and are attached to one another via a swiveling linkage.  I especially liked that the separate cross pole that holds out the sides of the tent didn’t cross the other poles exactly where they meet each other, but rather they cross on the opposite side of the tent’s peak.  This creates a triangular arrangement between the poles in the roof that I believe gives the entire structure a bit more rigidity. I expect that each pole can brace against the other two when the tent is hit by a gust, though I admittedly have not had the tent in a big windstorm yet, so I can’t confirm that this is the case. In addition, I thought that the unique “wings” were creative, and they really do add a considerable amount of extra room inside the tent.  Though it is not absolutely necessary to stake them out, the fact that they can be staked provides additional points to help hold the tent down in high winds.  There are also several tabs for attaching guy lines, which for me are critical.  The full coverage fly is adequate to prevent rain from being blown into the tent.  The orientation and position of the vent close to the peak had me a bit worried about wind carrying rain in through it and I haven’t been in conditions to test for that possibility, but it has seemed to do fine keeping rain out under non-windy conditions.  One might grumble that the vent is too small to be of much value at preventing condensation inside the fly.  In my experience, there is no venting system that will guarantee a condensation-free tent under all conditions, so I wouldn’t worry too much about the vent, as long as it doesn’t let rain in.  The construction is solid and consistent with my experience with Marmot gear (which I am, in general, a fan of).  The tent was intuitive to set up.  The gear hammock is clever, though I’m not sure about its long-term utility.  

Unfortunately, despite all of its good qualities, the tent suffers from a fatal flaw, which can only really be understood by crawling in and out of the tent itself, but I will do my best to explain.  The issue is the arrangement of the doors and rain fly, and the position of the zipper on the fly.  We’ll tackle this from the perspective of exiting the tent after a rainy night in northern Minnesota, but the same issues would be at play when entering.  In our scenario it was raining last night, so you had the fly zipped down to the ground.  Happily, you and your gear are currently dry (way to go Limelight!), but there is plenty of condensation lurking on the inside of the fly (because of course there is).  To leave the tent, you have a couple options.  You can either fully open the big inner door, or you can try to just open the curved edge enough of a gap to squeeze through.  If you fully open the door, you will be able to easily access the zipper on the rainfly, unzip it, and crawl out.  On your way out, you will definitely get condensation smeared down your back as you brush against the fly.  After you escape, you will turn around to close things up, and discover that the unzipped rainfly is now hanging directly into the open tent door, and it is funneling rainwater and condensation straight into the tent (no tent design should allow this to happen, but in the Limelight it does).  This problem could be somewhat mitigated by tying up the fly before you leave, but 1) that’s a pain when you are trying to be as speedy as possible (see mosquitoes, below; also, you probably really need to find the latrine) and 2) if it is still raining, you will now have rain entering the tent.  Further, in addition to all that wetness, the inside of the fly was lined with several hundred hungry mosquitoes, because mosquitoes love to hang out under rainflies.  As soon as you opened that big door and disturbed the rainfly, they all began swarming into the tent.  This did not make you popular with your tent mate.

What about the second option for exiting, in which you only partially open the door?  This is the preferred method for avoiding providing entry to all those mosquitoes.  However, if you only partially open the curved end of the door, which is at the corner of the tent rather than the center of the sidewall, you will be faced with the rainfly a couple inches from your nose rather than the rainfly zipper.  To reach the zipper, you will have to squeeze your body through the gap between the door and the rainfly until you can reach the fly’s zipper to open it.  This might limit the number of mosquitoes that get into the tent, but it is slow, it will absolutely soak you from the condensation, and it is awkward and uncomfortable.  It will also inevitably result in damage to the door, zipper, and mosquito netting as buttons, Velcro, and buckles on your clothes catch on the tent while you are squeezing past.  

The bottom line is that the unfortunate arrangement between the door and the fly make this tent unsuitable for camping in any situation where you expect rain and/or mosquitoes (or other flying nocturnal blood-suckers).  It is possible that simply reversing the direction of the door, so that the curved end lies directly across from the fly’s zipper (rather than in the corner of the tent), would go a long way toward resolving this issue.  However, I still think that the rainfly would tend to channel water (rain or dew) into the tent when both are open.  As a recreational tent for families who are camping in the American southwest or other places where rain and insects are not a major concern, I think it would do great.  For anyone who needs to ensure that their tent will stay dry and bug-free in less-than-ideal conditions, I recommend looking elsewhere.
review.name: promising tent with a fatal flaw

review.name: Limerock 3

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tent is really super cool. I love the "cubbies" on either side, like little night stands. My partner and I bought it for the two of us despite it being a 3P, and that was our mistake, not Marmot's. We recognize now that its pack-down size is too bulky for our backpacking excursions, so we should have gotten the 2P one. The only catch for us that is likely not applicable to other people is the fact that the cubbies require stakes to function properly. Our backpacking locations cannot rely on stakes, and for this reason only are we going with another tent, which makes me so sad, because I'm obsessed with the tent layout and space.
review.name: Roomy and Innovative!

review.reviewBody:
Awesome tent worth the price.
Roomy
Smartly designed
Easy to set up
review.name: Best tent I've owned

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using this tent for 3 years now. The design is smart and practical, including the internal height, the aerodynamic shape, the open to, the vestibule - and it's a piece of cake to put it up / take it down in less than 3 minutes total (2 people) or 5 minutes (1 person, inc. packing it away). I have found it to be the best in its price category. It has withstood 100kmph wind and 120 Fahrenheit in the Canyonlands, extreme damp and mud in the Olympic NP, snow camping in snow storm in Crater Lake NP and a lot of other challenges in between. Still as reliable as new.

Is it perfect? No... but so far as good as it gets for the investment. I give it 4.5 stars - half reduction for the fact that the side gets pulled up at the bottom when the top cross-pole is in use (I usually don't put it in) and well, the weight is great but like all tents of this size, it "gets noticeably heavier" every dozen miles day during a 10-day hike, if you know what I mean:)  Anyone who mentioned that it gets ripped easily or the zippers get stuck easily are either bots of have a lot of outdoor practicing to do.

By the way, the color not only looks cool but also helps to spot the tent when you're hiking back to your camp in the middle of nowhere, regardless of the dominant colors of the environment. Would / will buy it again.
review.name: Excellent design, my favorite tent in its class

name: Limelight Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

review.itemreviewed: ARC Turq C3 GX AXS Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: Spent almost a year looking for the ideal hardtail. I procrastinated thinking a 29" wheel set was overkill and more difficult to handle. In the end, I am so glad I went for it, the bike handles so well. I absolutely love it. The electric drive train is new to me, but so far is a blast to use. The bike arrived 90% assembled and setup right out of the box was so easy.
review.name: Pure Fun!

review.itemreviewed: ARC Turq C3 GX AXS Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody:
Im not sure most people would buy this buy as a 1 quiver bike to do it all, but I did. I live on the front range of Colorado and recently traded in my cheap/heavy full suspension to go to the #hardtail gang. This bike is insane. It truly climbs like a dream (I now beat some of my friends who mtn bike regularly on uphills). It can send it downhill with a lot of control (i've taken it down a black and it did great but it was a little rowdy). I can also lock out the suspension and take it on a standard gravel ride (which I know I will do more of as I get older). This is exactly what I wanted. A single bike that wont have too much maintenance that I will ride maybe 15-20 times a year for the next 10 years. 

I bought the T3 and I do love the electronic shifter. I've never ridden a bike this light but also feels so sturdy. 

My only upgrade will probably be swapping out the stock 2.6's for some 2.4's/2.3's but they have been awesome so far- may just run em til their kicked.
review.name: 3 months in...fantastic

review.itemreviewed: ARC Turq C3 GX AXS Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: Bike came quickly and very well packed. Minimal assembly and pretty much ready to ride. Complaints on the components are limited: stem handle bar combo is all aluminum and a boat anchor; dropper post is also heavy and unnecessary where I ride, so that also swapped out for carbon; finally, the wireless SRAM is very good but not adjusted well prior to shipping. Will have to sort it out or take it to someone who knows the derailleur better than me. The reviews on the bike online are all accurate and I don’t need to repeat them. It is an epic hardtail…
review.name: Yeti is brilliant

name: ARC Turq C3 GX AXS Mountain Bike

review.reviewBody: Light and strong! All you need. Never have to decide whether they’re worth lugging around on a big day
review.name: Solid and reliable

review.reviewBody: Light to use and folds up small to fit in my pack. I am now on my 3rd pair over 15 years and have walked thousands of kms , mostly on light hilly trails with them. The folding mechanism starts to get sticky and then fail but it is worth replacing with a new pair of poles
review.name: Light but sturdy

review.reviewBody: I'm rather new to hiking with poles and didn't see the need...however I am a total convert. These poles are so easy to pack, lightweight, and add stability and speed to my hikes. I also get some upper body exercise. Love these poles!
review.name: Favorite hiking poles!

review.reviewBody: Weather it’s an outing with the gals or a 2000 vert quick workout, these poles performed wonderfully. Super light weight. Hardly noticeable. Transferred power to aid in uphill hiking. Packed down quick to stow while scrambling or moving quickly downhill. I loved the fixed length. Took all the guesswork out of adjusting.
review.name: Lightweight, packable, great power transfer

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for storage in a small pack. Easy to collapse.
review.name: Great light weight poles

review.reviewBody:
I have always used telescoping poles prior to these. Find over time and heavy use they  wear out and constantly loosen and slip down while in use which gets annoying. Used these on a 50 mile thru hike they were great! No worry w shrinking and o loved that I could fold and tuck them away in pack pockets on parts of the trail while still 
walking.  No need to stop to put them away or take them out. Compact storage also helped reduce any chance of getting them snagged while stored on branches in thick brush areas. Definitely happy with this purchase at this point. Hopefully they last longer than my previous poles. For those wondering on height chart ( I had to exchange mine for taller ones) I am 5’4 and was happy with 115 for height. Was able to have that level L shape holding them you see in diagram. 110 were definitely too short.
review.name: Z hiking poles

review.reviewBody: Same as the men’s poles but available in shorter lengths and a more interesting color. Use care swapping baskets as the plastic threads on the pole strip easily
review.name: Works for men too

review.reviewBody: I followed the recommendation of my bf who has had his for years and I’m ultimately happy with these extremely light weight, easy to use poles. They collapse and expand so easily, it makes trail running a lot more fun. Also like the turquoise and the tiny bit smaller handles compared to the men’s size.
review.name: Best hiking poles I’ve ever had

review.reviewBody: I just bought these poles after being a long-time user of another brand. They are the perfect weight, lightweight but not too light to be flimsy or unstable. The foam grips are comfortable and seem to be designed to grab onto them the “correct” way. The poles also come apart and snap back together very quickly and can be done while walking or running. So far I’ve used the poles on a few shorter runs and hikes and an eight-hour mountain run. They hold up really well!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: My previous pole bent when I fell and couldn't be repaired due to age. The new ones are feather light and the perfect size. Carrying items is painful due to arthritis but these are the exception. Thank you!
review.name: The Best!

name: Distance Carbon Z Poles - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received the Futura Air Trek 50 + 10 in the mail about two weeks ago and since receiving it we’ve been on a camping trip to Blue Ridge, Georgia for a weekend getaway. It was absolutely perfect. This backpack is versatile with great storage. I highly recommend this product.
review.name: Great Product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so excited to get this hiking backpack to store all of my things the features on this bag are absolutely fantastic for anyone that does backpacking or hiking trip the quality of the material is super and the look is just as nice I would highly recommend picking up this bag for any Avid Outdoors people
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these so I can take stuff when I go fishing down the river so I can pack everything without having to forget anything at the truck holds a ton and easy to open and close has lots of pockets so lots of storage.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is amazing!  It is super lightweight!  I was so comfortable carrying it.  I am so happy that I got to try it!  I will highly recommend to my friends and family! Will for sure buy more products from this line!

I assure you, you can take a lot of things inside

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a fantastic hiking bag I hike trails all the time and used this on one of the long hikes took this and used the Futura air trek backpack it was so incredibly comfortable wearing this backpack it is wonderful how I can adjust this to where I want it to go the pockets are excellent for plenty of room for storage the quality of this backpack is very nice I also love the color of the backpack too this is by far my favorite backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag has all the features! Very sturdy! Has the brace on the back. One thing that I didn't like was the spot for the camel back (water pouch) it's pretty small. And I can't use the one I already had!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My little one loves this product! As soon as I took it out of the package, he wanted to try it on and he left it on all night lol. Thank you to Blackstrap and Influenster! We will be using this in the winter and snow!
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so excited to have been chosen  for this campaign as this is going to be great for winter time for new england and the winter activities i have planned. My daughter loved the fit as its not super thick that its overwhelming its easy to breath making it super breathable the comfort and fit is kid and mom approved and i can see the durability will hold well. I am super excited would i recommend ? Of course i think this is so much safer than scarfs or extra layers as they can block your eyes, or wrap around incorrectly and cause accidents specially when skiing or doing any outside activity
review.name: Great accesory for new england weather

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The kids Hood Balaclava  is very cute  my daughter loves it never mind it’s not the color she wanted because all the cute colors was sold out.  They do fit well it’s fitted and stretch very durable it will last a very long time. It’s very well made great quality of materials. I love how versatile it is and it keeps you warm during the cold weather. I’m about to purchase one for my husband he loves it too.
review.name: Cute Balaclava

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like its warmth, I like its breathability, its comfort is quite good, its fit is excellent and its durability is very good, its fabric is quite good.
review.name: I like

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] When I first saw the hood I thought it was a bit small , but once my daughter tried it on, it fit just right. The material is stretchy so it makes it easy to put it on and remove. It’s made with moisture wicking material which helps so much because my daughter sweats a lot. Even though the material is thin it kept her warm and she was able to still feel comfortable and breathe without any issues.
review.name: True to size

review.reviewBody: The quality, comfort and design of this is most appreciated! Shipping was very quick. Would recommend for all pursuing outdoor activities or just wanting to have a "Ninja" hood!
review.name: Kid's Balaclava

review.reviewBody: Fit, materials, quality, BS label tag! I’d love this sizing in a cheetah print, I’m a girl and the kids fits perfect for my smaller face.
review.name: Blackstrap Kids

review.reviewBody: Fit the 3,5 and 7 year old kids I got them each one just different colors! They loved them and super warm!
review.name: Such a cool gift for kids!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and versatile. Lightweight is great for all conditions.
review.name: Great stuff

review.reviewBody: Previously used a different brand balaclava for my junior skiers but it always slipped off their nose and left exposed in harsh New England conditions.  But the Kids Hood BalaClava stays up when it needs to or just as easily pulls down when needed, keeping the little guys' faces warm and covered when necessary.  The many color options allowed me to match both of their helmets as well - would highly recommend for years of use and functionality!
review.name: Great coverage and performance for my 3 and 5 year olds!

name: Solid JR Hood - Kids'

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable, light and nice design.  Marrell is my favorite shoes company.
review.name: My Best Buy.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these after signing up to be a volunteer in Central Park.. first time wearing ankle non-fashion boots! and 65 years old-- 
I tried them on in a store that had a mock, resin? boulder to climb up and down on.
They felt the best of 3-4 other pair/brands I tried, though that is a subjective thing- and quite brief.
So I cannot compare them to any other hiking boots' performance..

But they have been excellent- so far. I've probably worn them 6-9 hours 'in the field'! They feel substantive, protective, and sturdy.
review.name: first time hiking boots and Merrell wearer..
comment: Thanks!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I live and hike mostly through large rock formations near my home in Prescott AZ.  Many of these rocks are pretty steep but, with this shoe I have the utmost confidence I can leap from rock to rock without slipping. Inclines and declines, the grip is solid. Also, a very comfortable shoe to wear. This is my third pair of this shoe and I plan on sticking with the brand and style.
review.name: Best gripping sole ever!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: True to size and very comfortable.  I wear a 10 and bought a 10.5 women’s for comfort while hiking. I would recommend a .5 up.
review.name: Very comfortable. Order a 1/2 size up

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These hikers are great. I have arthritic feet and Merrell is my go-to solution. These shoes have the support I need, are accurately sized and super cute at the same time. Score!
review.name: Super cute hikers

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love that they’re comfortable, right from the start. No need to break them in.
review.name: Terrific comfy boots
comment: Thanks for the great review!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these to replace a pair of Merrell hiking boots that had finally fallen apart after 20 years and hundreds of miles. They are the same great, sturdy but light-weight boots that I love. They didn't require any break in time and I have happily worn them through some wet and slippery conditions with zero complaints.
review.name: I still really love my Merrells

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Got these for a hiking trip to Zion national park. Straight out of the box, comfortable and stayed that way thru all the hikes! Very impressed with the grip on the trails, especially the steep parts up and down.
review.name: Highly recommend!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these boots! I hike with my dogs all summer and snowshoe all winter. They are perfectly comfortable right out of the box!! I’ve been wearing this brand for 15 years. When one pair wears out ( usually I get a couple years) I purchase another pair.
review.name: Best boots ever.
comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Boots are very comfortable but not good on icy sidewalks - disappointing
review.name: New boots and Ice

name: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: These are not junior size gloves as advertised- they are baby/toddler size! Size 6 on baby Hestra size chart, not size 6 junior/kids. Also didn’t come with Hestra handcuffs- arguably the best feature of Hestra gloves for kids. Very disappointed.
review.name: Baby not junior size!

review.reviewBody: I purchased for my child for Christmas to go skiing. I ordered early due to concern for shipping/back order issues with pandemic. She then used them on our first ski trip after Christmas this weekend. With hand warmers she didn't even make it an hour and her hands were freezing. I expected a lot more from Hestra. I called Backcountry to return but they said they were outside the 30 day return policy and because they were used wouldn't give store credit or exchange either. Seems being prepared for shipping/back order issues leaves the customer without option. I won't use company or brand again.
review.name: Terrible glove and customer service

review.reviewBody: This shirt is super light and comfortable. I wear this when kayaking. Breathes well and protects from the sun. It’s a tad brighter color than anticipated, which is just my personnel preference. But overall a great shirt for outdoor activity then out to eat or drinks.
review.name: Great short

review.reviewBody:
I bought this shirt before the summer backpacking/hiking season started. It is a GREAT shirt; looks good, feels good, works well (keeps you cool). UNFORTUNATELY, it appears to be made from hopes and dreams...for the shirt began to melt and fall apart before halfway through summer. Mind you, backpacking days were only 4 trips about 4 days each, the rest was day hiking. Sadly the shirt will probably last only one more season--if the wife allows it.

Damage: weird bubbling around the cuffs, lots of parts where its getting fuzzy/worn through. (Sadly I am at work and can't snap photos!)
review.name: Good shirt, however, it will only last one season!

review.reviewBody: What a find. The long sleeve Astroman sun shirts shirts are amazingly light weight and super comfy and a fraction of the cost of sunscreen over the years. Buy one and see what all the fuss is about.
review.name: Comfy and Light

review.reviewBody: This was a gift for my boyfriend. He liked the short sleeve version so much, I got the long sleeve version for him to wear on an upcoming hiking trip to Italy. Soft, comfortable, provides sun-protection, great for layering. Looks good too!
review.name: Looks great and protects from the sun too

review.reviewBody: This was a gift for my boyfriend. He liked the short sleeve version so much, I got the long sleeve version for him to wear on an upcoming hiking trip to Italy. Soft, comfortable, provides sun-protection, great for layering. Looks good too!
review.name: Perfect for layering - looks good too!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for the hubby. He loves it. Only issue is it does hold odors but he eats a lot of garlic.....love the color. It looks great in photos nice and light,but works for a wide range of temperatures.
review.name: Handsome man

review.reviewBody: Cool, light weight, high quality, great fit and sun protection all in one package. After buying the first one I bought several more of them as well.
review.name: Great shirts

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing this model shirt nearly every day since I bought my first one (this is my third). In summer or winter, the light weight, stretchable fabric keeps me cool or adds a layer of warmth. This color is a step up - for going out to the museum, dinner, wherever when at home or traveling.
review.name: An elegant update to my favorite shirt

review.reviewBody: Very breathable and light. Stretch allows for full range of motion where other sunshirts do not. Works great in all situations; on the trail, in the office, and casual dinners.
review.name: Best button up sunshirt yet

review.reviewBody: Website isn't clear about which colours are UPF 30 vs 50 - and all three shirts I received were UPF 30. It says that "dark colours" are UPF 50, but there's no way to know what that includes. Even the blue shirt I ordered (Olympic Plaid) was only UPF 30. People typically buy UPF clothing because they want the sun protection, so OR needs to do a better job communicating what protection their products offer.
review.name: Mostly UPF 30

review.reviewBody: I have not use these in the cold yet, but I can tell just by how they feel that they will be very warm. I purchase them on sale to bring with me on a trip to Alaska and to keep in my repertoire for skiing and backcountry experiences. I am a 5 foot 10 125 foot woman and I started with a size 8, then a nine and settled on a size 10. I have hands that are proportionate to my body, but I don’t consider them to be very large and my fingers are slim. I really think these gloves run small.
review.name: Quality, great fit & comfort

review.reviewBody:
Since I got my first pair of Hestra's, I have never looked back. They are easily the most comfortable, and highest quality gloves out there. The leather holds up better than any synthetic I've tried, and I have pairs that I still wear that are 7+ years old. As long as you take care of them (keep them oiled, and waterproofed), they will last for years. 

I also have owned most of the styles (gloves, mittens, and the split finger mittens), and I have to say that mittens are usually my go to for colder days, since I can easily layer a liner with them.
review.name: Hestra is the GOAT

review.reviewBody:
Got these mittens to replace a pair of failing Burton Gondie Gloves, and they did the trick! Was in the Alps for a week, lows in the single digits (F), and my hands were never cold! They are easy to get on and off, fit my hands well, and the inside dried out quickly (from hand sweat, not water intrusion).

One critical thing to do when I got them was to bake them at a low temp, apply wax, and repeat a few times. This really upped the water resistance and kept out anything from my hands.

On top of all that, they look awesome, I expect to have these for years to come!
review.name: Great in the Deeps

review.reviewBody:
So, I had to leave a review because I almost didn't buy these because of the other review here offering 1 star.  I know opinions are subjective but I could not be happier with these.

First off, warmth:
My hands are always cold ... always.  I just wanted something warm and these gloves kept me toasty warm snowboarding today with a high of 8 degrees.

For once, it actually dumped snow here in the east last night and the adjustable cuff kept the powder out, and hands warm and dry.

Functionality:
Had no issues buckling/unbuckling bindings.  Inside the glove is a warm liner which has what I would describe as slots for fingers but it is not a glove.  Fingers stay close together to keep you warm, but in place.
review.name: Too good to not review

name: Freeride CZone Mitten

review.reviewBody: Beautiful color and super warm.  The pullover is just a bit short, but doesn’t seem to be a problem so far.

review.reviewBody: Love the look, feel, and cozy weight. However, arms were too short and the torso was a little short (I'm a fit model for another brand, so my body shouldn't be far from standard measurements). I'm always a size SMALL but have now purchased a size LARGE so the arms and body can fit right. Really, really wish there was a draw cord, so the body of the garment wouldn't hang away from me like a bell, letting all the cold air inside. But that's what I get for ordering two sizes larger than I am.
review.name: Almost Great

review.reviewBody:
I just received. Worried that will be small but it fit perfect.
I am 164cm 62kg regular M size.
I ordered M not tight or to lose. Slightly has rooms.
It’s have Patagonia fleece that is similar look as this 
I think this one is more ticker a bit heavier but it’s really warm.
No need laying so not necessary to size up.
review.name: Fit great and high quality

review.reviewBody: Didn’t fit, will return to store in London, thank you

review.reviewBody: ... and I'm always cold. I wear it with thermals in place of a puffy on cold camping mornings (40-50 degrees F). however the non-stretchy arms and boxy fit took some getting used to (but I love how it looks and get compliments on it)

review.reviewBody: I ordered a size larger then your guideline indicated and the glove was still very tight. I wore them on opening day when the temp was in the teens and my hands froze even with a heat pack in the rear compartment.

comment: Thank you for taking the time to submit your review, Ed. We are sorry you found the gloves to be too tight and not as warm as you hoped. The XPLORE S is our warmest glove model and should be comfortable in sub-zero conditions, especially with the added heat pack. For those seeking the ultimate in warmth we recommend the XPLORE S Mitten. The gloves should run true to size, but we are happy to get you a larger size to see if there is a better fit, and if so, maybe they provide additional warmth. Another option would be the XPLORE S MITT as that is our warmest product.

review.reviewBody: Dont remember if my hands ever got cold this season
review.name: No cold fingers

review.reviewBody: Warm, Good fit, Work great with trigger s poles. Have been using Leki Gloves and Poles for 15 Years.

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Airpin Ultralight Stakes - 2-Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Airpin Ultralight Stakes - 2-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Airpin Ultralight Stakes - 2-Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Nemo Airpins because I wanted to lighten the weight of my stakes without sacrificing durability. 

I primarily hike in the White Mountains where the rocky soil can bend those ultralight candy-cane style titanium stakes. I steered clear of the nail-style pegs because, while they are light, they tend to be made of two-to-three components (head, body and sometimes a separate tip) that are glued or swaged together and I did not want to mess with a stake that could fail at the joint (the ground is not a forgiving medium when jabbing into it). 

My preference is the single-piece three-sided Y-Beam style aluminum stakes because you can stomp them into the ground with confidence and they come in handy as an eating utensil when your friend forgets their spork. But, they are not as light or compact as the Airpins. 

The Airpins, I am happy to say, have come with me on multiple trips between NH and ME this summer and have satisfied all my needs. They are barely noticeable in my pack, they take up very little space and are light as heck. They have held securely in the soil overnight and in the morning, when breaking camp, they are easier to clean dirt off of compared to the y-beam style stakes (which can take a while to clean off). If you are looking to lighten your pack and do not want to sacrifice durability, these lime-green stakes will delight you.
review.name: Minimalism and quality at it's finest

review.reviewBody: These are the perfect stakes to anchor your tent. They are strong for their size!
review.name: Easy to use

review.reviewBody: Super light but extremely durable. I highly recommend these for anyone looking!
review.name: Very durable

review.reviewBody: Highest quality, was not sure about the notches about everything is great equipment
review.name: A BUY

review.reviewBody: Finally got my hands on the new Nemo Airpin tent stakes.  I was mainly interested in using them in my Poncho tarp setup.  I think they are the perfect answer to have a simple and lightweight setup for my MyTrail Poncho.
review.name: Perfect for my Poncho Tarp Setup

review.reviewBody: Great idea - love the look, feel, weight, self locking mechanism...but why only 6"?  Too short to keep firmly in ground.  8" would have been better IMO
review.name: too short?

name: Airpin Ultralight Stakes - 2-Pack

review.reviewBody: These are durable, ergonomic, light, and good-looking.  Pretty much the perfect sport draw, unless you're doing long multi-pitch routes where you'd want something ultralight with dyneema.  That being said I will still probably use these at chico potrero.  It is worth noting that buying the six pack vs buying individual will yield slightly different products.  With the six pack, each draw has the DMM logo sewn onto one side of the dogbone, whereas the individually sold units do not.  The blue portion of the straight gate biner is also a slightly different color, although I'd chock that up to likely a difference in production batch.
review.name: My favourite draw available

review.reviewBody:
It was about a month ago when the realization that I will be moving out in August and will have to stop using my dad's climbing rack hit me. That sent me spiraling into an online shopping spree like no other. I spent hours (mostly at work because even while I am sitting here writing this there is no one else that I can see at my work) searching high and low for the perfect draws to buy and call my own. Originally I was going to buy a full set of black diamond or Petzl draws, but then as I was going to checkout with my cart full of them I came across these draws, and man am I glad I didn't settle for average. I have climbed with these draws only a few times, but as any experienced climber knows it only takes one climb to fall in love or to hate a draw. 

When I first got the box it was heavier than I thought it should be and this worried me greatly, but soon as I had a draw out and in my hand all worries disappeared. I am used to climbing with super light weight trad draws from Petzl that don't seem to add any weight at all, so all draws in my hands feel super heavy. Not these ones. While yes, they are a little heavier than high end trad draws, they are lighter than any other draw I have ever had and they rack so nicely on a harness. The next step as any climber knows is to take them climbing as soon as possible! I did just that. The next morning at early O'clock I was pulling out of my driveway to head up to the crag. When I got there I went to a long warm up climb, racked up, and started climbing. Near the top of the climb I began to panic, the weight which would normally let me know how many draws I had on each side of me seemed to tell me I was almost completely out of draws! Then I looked down and saw that I still had 6 of these draws on my harness. THEY WERE SO LIGHT I HAD TO DOUBLE CHECK THAT THEY WERE STILL ON MY HARNESS!! That isn't why I am leaving this super long review though. The reason I am leaving this review is because normally when I am clipping a draw I have to have a little battle with my fingers, the rope, and the gate in order to clip in to them, but these draws just ate the rope all day! I didn't have to struggle once with clipping these draws, or, even more impressive in my opinion, unclipping and cleaning these draws. It doesn't matter if you are a professional climber who is giving Adam Andre a run for his money or if you are just beginning to get into climbing with a friend to have something to do during this pandemic or throughout college, these draws are a must have on anyone's rack. 

My only complaint about them is that they looked so pretty when they came that it was sad to get them scratched up from being on the rock. 

12/10 recommend to anyone who lead climbs.
review.name: My love affair with these draws...

name: Shadow Quickdraw - 6-Pack

hasVariant.name: El Mono Trucker Hat
hasVariant.description: Buy the Howler Brothers El Mono Trucker Hat online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I lost my favorite trucker hat that I've been using for 5 years, and was thrilled to see this cool looking hat! I couldn't tell 2 things from the picture though. First, I was under the impression that the adjustment on the back was one of those clips that you slide the tab of fabric through, but it is in fact velcro. I'm not a big fan of velcro adjustments, but this was of very high quality, and probably would have been fine.
Second, I thought from the curve of the bill that it would be a more classic baseball cap shape with a shallower head space. I am a woman, and so when I wear the larger trucker hat style I either have to tuck my ears inside, or look like dumbo with the hat pushing them out to the side. I'm disappointed that this hat was too large/deep because it is really a very cool and well made hat.
review.name: Too big

name: El Mono Trucker Hat

review.reviewBody: I didn't like the briefs at all in fact I unfortunately threw them out because I didn't like them at all. The briefs were way too thin. The color was supposed to be white but looked more cream color. And the tag was super long and annoying. I hate to put a bad review like this but I'm just being honest and won't buy again.

comment:
Hello,

Thank you for posting your review on our Men's Everyday Brief. We are sorry to hear that our product is not as you expected. 

We will make sure to forward your feedback about the fabric and the tags to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.exofficio.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9AM-5PM EST.

Thank you! 
ExOfficio Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I've had ExO travel briefs before. They were excellent. These "Everyday" models are a different material. Comfy, for sure. I hope durability and longevity will be proven as they will be washed in sinks, buckets and showers from Vancouver to Viet Nam. Regarding fit, ExO offers these in sizes in M (32-34) and L(34-36). What about an athletic guy like me, in between sizes with a 35 inch waist? I buy the mediums and they fit perfectly. I think the large would be too big. Note to manufacturers: Odd number sizes matter!
review.name: Comfy.

review.reviewBody: Water resistant and wind resistant. So comfortable and cute.
review.name: Buy these for real!

review.reviewBody: Great for this curvy girl!  So hard finding ski clothing that fits my curves.  Thank you Halfday!  The only improvement would be belt loops.
review.name: Get these ski pants!

review.reviewBody: Never have I ever fit in a medium ski pant due to my athletic built. I’ve always had to buy large that required alterations. Let me tell you… with these pants I was able to buy my actual size (medium) and they fit like a GLOVE. Not to mention the high waist which is (chefs kiss) 1
review.name: Amazing fit

review.reviewBody:
I got the bib a month ago and sent it back for these pants (the bib was too restrictive, but insulated) and I was so excited to see what these pants had to offer and was so disappointed pulling them out of the bag. First these pants are definitely more applicable to spring skiing weather they feel more like a shell than a genuine snow pant, you would freeze even with a base layer on especially in the middle of January. And I sized up bc the bib was too restrictive my mistake bc these were huge on me, so while I get a bib and snow pant are different in stitching and what not the sizing between the two needs to be way better in similarity. Also while they are big there is too much tension in the legs/backside to get into a comfortable ski position if you’re an avid skier. Also their outfits need more pockets. We are skiers we would be lost without our pockets
The color options though are amazing that is the one upside compared to other brands and I get this is a new company, but theres so so much more room for growth and potential. This outfit is good for an Xgames look, but not functional enough save your money you’re better off buying from any other ski brand.
review.name: Needs work
comment: Hi there, thank you so much for submitting your review. We're so sorry to hear that your recent experience with us did not live up to your expectations. Rest assured your feedback has been passed along to our teams so we can do better in the future!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and length. Do not size up. I am 5’11” and could have used one more inch on the length but they’re good enough, especially compared to most other brands. These are flattering for sure! Not a lot of pocket space, but I guess that’s to be expected if you want a slimmer fit!
review.name: Impressed with these pants.

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for warm, durable ski gear, and I went with Halfdays because it's made for women, by women! I love the Alessandra Pant — the material feels really cozy on the inside, smooth on the outside, and the adjustable high waist is unbelievably flattering. I'm 5'4" and ordered the XS. These are my favorite pants, they're perfect!
review.name: Cutest ski pants out there

review.reviewBody: Love these pants! I ordered an XL. I’m usually between a L and XL. They fit great and are really comfortable.
review.name: Cute and comfy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] You can't beat these. Ladies, the color and cut is *major*. I get so many compliments on them. The only improvement I'd add is to make the bottom of the pants a little wider as it can be a little snug on snowboard boots but still works.
review.name: Pretty color and very warm!

review.name: Amazing snowpants! A must buy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these pants! So cute and warm, plus fully functional for a day on the mountain. They are my go to resort ski pants.
review.name: Perfect ski pants!

review.reviewBody: I am planning a cold weather trip and purchased these as a mid-layer for hiking and tent camping. I am 23, 5,1”, and weigh 105Ibs. Generally I have to purchase from the kids section because most adult clothing is only getting bigger and bigger these days and its hard to find clothing that fits. I purchased the girls XL but they look like they are an adult L/XL and are still way TOO big. I like the style and comfort of these pants so I will be returning them and ordering the size M instead.

review.itemreviewed: Arizona Chunky Suede Narrow Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Bought these as a birthday gift for my sister, and she loves them! They have the comfy Birkenstocks insole, with extra cushioning of a thick outersole. She walks to work and wanted these shoes so she’d be a little elevated from the dirty city streets.

I was personally surprised that the shoes came in a Papillio box and say Papillio on the insole (instead of Birkenstock), but my sister expected that and didn’t have a problem with it.
review.name: My sister loves them!

name: Arizona Chunky Suede Narrow Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: The Vans were a gift, and well received. Sizing was perfect,  so exactly as expected.
review.name: Vans excellent buy

review.reviewBody: Second time coming with these shoes comfy as ever!
review.name: Nothing beats the OG old skool vans!

review.reviewBody: Great show for my daughter. Comfortable and stylish
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Comfy fit around heel, but canvas was thin and cheap to justify the cost. Stitching caused front to  ripple. Returned straight away.
review.name: Look and feel cheap

review.reviewBody: Spider man sneakers art design was amazing from the spider punk to the spider man logo to the quotes and numbers perfect
review.name: Spider man sneakers art designed beautiful

review.reviewBody: I unsubscribed from Vans emails as they spammed my inbox after purchasing this item. Despite doing so I got another review request the very next day. Always give them a burner. Can't comment on the product, I've only had it a week.
review.name: Spam

review.reviewBody: Hannah who served me was polite and patient and I was happy with the purchase
review.name: Happy Shopper

review.reviewBody: Feeling quite uncomfortable in overall feeling. Impossible to wear for a longer period of time.
review.name: Uncomfortable
comment:
Hey there
 
We're really sorry to hear that you’re experiencing discomfort with our Vans Sk8-Hi Grey!
 
Your feedback is valuable, and we regret that this style is not as comfortable as you expected and that they are difficult to wear for extended periods.
 
Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us and has been passed along to the appropriate teams for further review!
 
We appreciate you bringing this to our attention!

review.reviewBody: They asked to try them shoes in store to see if it was my right size which was cool, considering I never wore vans before and sizing can often be a bit of an issue
review.name: Sk8 vans

name: Sk8-Hi Shoe

description: Buy the Evoc Duo Tailgate Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Duo Tailgate Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Evoc Duo Tailgate Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Duo Tailgate Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Evoc Duo Tailgate Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a great tailgate pad. Put mine through the ringer all last summer.  Best part of it is that when adjusted just right, I can keep the pad on and it is able to close with my Bakflip tonneau cover.  If you're like me, you like your stuff locked up. Taking the pad on/off all the time is not ideal and this one works. So much so I'm buying a 2nd one so I can take more than two bikes. And no worries on blocking the rear view cam too!!
review.name: Excellent - Works with Bakflip

review.reviewBody:
I have always had pickups, and I have owned a few different pickup pads.  backup cameras are awesome, but make trouble for the fit of a pickup pad.  My latest truck, and jeep gladiator, is small and has a backup camera, and none of the pads would fit properly.

This little Evoc pad is perfect, quick to install, easy to leave on indefinitely, and has the most engineering and fit and finish of any of the pads I have tried recently.  I would even consider a second pad for more bikes.  

This is definitely best for one bike.  Very easy to toss a bike in for a quick ride.  Two bikes fit well with some attention to make sure nothing is rubbing.  Three bikes no way.
review.name: Nice for 1, maybe 2 bikes

name: Duo Tailgate Pad

hasVariant.name: Transporter Waterproof 70L Duffel Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Transporter Waterproof 70L Duffel Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is unbelievable, design that lets it be more comfortable than most regular backpacks, even when full. Only way a duffle leaves you hands free.
review.name: This bag is unbelievable, design

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I took this down the Grand Canyon and it kept my gear dry for the whole trip. I was concerned about grit in the zipper, but had no such issues in the field. We even inflated it (empty) and took it for a swim at Matkat. Was just like riding a rodeo bull down a rapid. 10/10
review.name: I took this down the

review.reviewBody: I gambled and got this over the Yeti Panga, based on the Osprey having a better shoulder strap system. While i’m sure this is as water resistant as Osprey claims, I was surprised at how thin the material was. It didn’t seem like this would stand up to longterm abuse. Zipper seemed great. Looks slick. Straps are great. But material didn’t inspire confidence.  Returned. Got a Panga.
review.name: A little thin

name: Transporter Waterproof 70L Duffel Bag

review.reviewBody: I've used these shorts 4 times. Once, for half a day of mainly downhill rides. Fell once and got scratched up pretty good, yet the shorts had no wear marks or tears. A second day was for 20 miles and 3000' and the liners felt fine. Lots of big pockets although I tend to put my valuables in my backpack. The only "negative"? They look like a fully functional mountain biking short. Meaning, you can't necessarily wear them when you're not riding and still look cool. I have a pair of Fox shorts(34) that look great on or off the bike but that's subjective, hence, the 5-star review. I'm a 34W and the Large waist is perfect. I don't need to use the side adjusters at all so if I gain weight, I'm in trouble :) If you want numbered sizes, like a "34", you need to pay a little more. Great value so far.
review.name: Comfortable, durable, and good pockets.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of the Ether shorts.  No other compares!
review.name: Good padding and shorts!

review.reviewBody: Pleased with this. Free! Get up To An Extra 20% OFF Coupons from coupon-bird. com (No space)
review.name: Pleased with this.

review.reviewBody: I have had two of these, one being replaced under warranty due to Zipper failure. One month into replacement the new one failed as well. All of the zippers failed on each of the shorts. The shorts themselves are not bad except that they are fairly bulky material; There are better shorts for warmer weather. I actually really like the liner
review.name: Zipper failure

review.reviewBody:
Pros:
Pockets hold a lot
Taped pocket zippers keep it clean and dry
Adjustable waistband and fly snap let you dial in fit
Fabric is lightweight and durable and provides nice range of motion

Cons:
One thigh pocket zipper failed after 2 years; fly zipper failed after 5 years (Zoic would not warranty)
I found the liner too tight on my thighs and stopped using them in favor of other chamois
review.name: Nice design; poor zipper quality

name: Ether Short + Essential Liner - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have tried a number of solutions from Pearl Izumi's P.R.O AmFib to Hestra Heli Gloves to Pogies.  None of them worked well for me.  The Pogies kept my hands warm, but I ride several different bikes and moving them around was a pain, so I would wind up riding without them hoping it wouldn't be to bad.    The sturmfist keeps my whole hand warm even my index finger and thumb pad, which were always the coldest.  The AmFib's work well for me (finger tip pads aren't cold) above about 35 degrees, but if I get at all sweaty and have to take the gloves off they are very hard to get back on as the interior starts to slide out.  I have not had any indication of this with the Sturmfist.  They are easy to get on and off even if my there is some sweat.  I've put in about 20 hours in the backcountry with them and there is no sign of wear.  I am hopeful that these will last for years.  They are a little on the large size, but I think that might be why they work so well.  I can wear a pair of regular cold weather gloves inside them.  Maybe when it gets below 0.
review.name: My finger are finally warm

review.reviewBody: Apparently, I have quite large hands (normal circumference, but long fingers).  Normally XL will barely fit, but XXL generally fits better.  The Sturmfist XL I purchased is no exception. I am returning this glove for no other reason than finger-length fit.  I think the glove is of good/excellent quality in all other regards.  I will be reordering again when Competitive Cylcist gets the XXL model in stock, which the (very helpful) salesman assured me was on order for next season.
review.name: Runs a Wee Bit Small

name: Sturmfist 4 Finger Glove

review.reviewBody:
Simply one of the most hardy overshirts out there! As the other review states - it looks great but does almost feel too nice to wear out in the woods or during camp cooking as I worry about getting grease stains on the buckskin colour I picked up.

Anyway, the main reason to buy this is the material - the G1000 is so robust as an outer layer - it's a material I've come to trust and was the main reason I purchased this shirt. I find I worry very little about pushing through thick foliage in this shirt.

Used as my main trekking shirt during a recent trip to Skye & Cairngorms and sat perfectly over a wool jumper without getting overheated at any point. It also dried very quickly after short/light showers and was able to fit a raincoat over the top when weather got more demanding without it feeling too awkward which could've been a potential drawback.

As someone who straddles the line between medium and small sizes the small fits perfectly and is sized appropriately as an overshirt to be worn over other items.

The jacket has two huge interior pockets positioned over the waist. These are great but could maybe be even better if repositioned to chest height. A simple change I would make is to increase the size of the chest pockets to accommodate larger phones (my pixel 6 fits but the pocket can't be closed while it's in there) and to either add an additional side loading pocket beneath each, or alternatively add chest level interior pocket for additional utility.

Any small quibbles are swept aside though by the prevailing hardiness of this shirt which is why I'm more than happy to give it 5 stars.
review.name: One of the best overshirts I've worn

review.reviewBody: I've worn it almost every day for 6 months and it works very well. It's a bit tight in the shoulders but it sits comfortably. The massive inside pockets make it extremely useful for carrying anything you want. I've crawled through mud with it and it keeps on going. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: This over shirt is perfect for chores on the ranch, thick enough to bust some brush in, nice enough to wear around town. 5'10 210lb, size large is perfect with room to layer underneath.
review.name: Well made, almost too nice for it's best use

review.reviewBody:
6ft / 38in chest and moderately athletic build. 
Medium in FJ jackets tends to fit me fine.
 This over shirt has comical space around the body.
 I can overlap the body some 4 inches side to side. That isn’t space for a T-shirt or laying - laying with a jumper ?  If I was wearing with jumper the shoulder would never work - which is about right.  
These have been cut with some guys with guys in mind 🙈

Sending back.
review.name: Huge

name: Singi Overshirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I find that Columbia shoe sizing is all over the place. I normally size up because their shoes tend to run small. review.reviewBody: I have 2 older pairs and they were high waisted. This pair is low cut and falls down.
review.name: Low cut
comment: We highly appreciate the honest feedback on the rise of these leggings, as we are always looking for ways to enhance our athlete experience and improve our gear.

review.reviewBody: truly a must have warmer if you are a skier or like to be in cold weather! I had used these for years and I am so happy with them!!! Just buy! true to size, I am usually a XS/small and got a small on these.
review.name: I love this leggings!!!!

review.reviewBody: This style fits well in the waistband thigh. However, the knees are so tight its almost impossible to bend them. I gave up after wearing 2 hours as nd packed them up and sent them back. I am 5’3” 115 pounds. I cannot believe that in every other aspect these pants fit perfectly but the knees were so tight that movement and squatting was almost impossible. Definitely size up.
review.name: Knee Lock
comment: We appreciate the honest feedback on the fit of these leggings throughout the knees. Our Product Development team is constantly working to provide athletes with the greatest feeling and performing leggings, and we will be sure to pass your feedback along.

review.reviewBody: These keep you so warm and they are so comfy
review.name: Most comfortable leggings

review.reviewBody: I am a huge fan of Under Armour and rarely find something I don’t like. Unfortunately, these leggings were awful. I am consistently a size small and everything I wear from Under Armour, but for some reason the small was way too tight. I went up to a medium, but the fit was still way off. The leggings come up higher in the front than in the back and they were so low on my waist that they kept inching down during movement. Considering that these are made for wearing during high periods of activity outdoors, this is a dealbreaker. they are also really baggy at the bottom and too tight everywhere else. Poor fit overall. You would’ve thought under armour would have this fit thing down pat by now. I’m completely perplexed by these leggings.
review.name: Awful fit
comment: We are very sorry to hear the fit/sizing isn't quite right for you and appreciate you taking the time to provide us with this feedback. We have forwarded your review to our Product Development Team for examination.

review.reviewBody: This product is a great compression fit. It’s just the right thickness to fit under jeans or other pants while still having comfort and movement.
review.name: Great for cold weather

review.reviewBody: Got these for my wife. She always loves the way they fit. These are her 3rd or 4th pair.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: I have a set of the old style 3.0's for women and I love them.  I tried to get another set as I use my other set at least a couple times a week.  The bottoms are very short, like I was wearing capri pants, the waist band is different material and the waist doesn't go as high up on your waist as the older style of 3.0's.  Over all I am disapointed in the new style.  I wish I could get another set of the old style 3.0's.
review.name: Size
comment: We are very sorry to learn that these leggings were not as expected. We highly appreciate the honest feedback, as we are always looking for ways to enhance our athlete experience and improve our gear.

review.reviewBody: These must be made for kids not adult women. Not even close to fitting my daughter.  Going back for a refund!!!
review.name: Horrible sizing
comment: We are very sorry to hear the sizing isn't quite right for you and appreciate you taking the time to provide us with this feedback. Your feedback is very valuable to us, as we will use it to ensure we improve upon this in the future!

description: Buy the Shimano PD-R550 SPD-SL Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PD-R550 SPD-SL Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano PD-R550 SPD-SL Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've been riding Shimano SPD-SL since they first released "The Lance Pedal" in 2003/2004.  He was using the older heavy Shimano "Look" style pedal for his first few Tour wins so Shimano created the SPD-SL version for him,  a lighter version than their earlier Look type.  Love him or hate him, this pedal was a sure winner and it's no wonder that the design remains basically the same almost two decades later.  

I chose this version over the Ultegra and Dura Ace for two simple reasons, first is the replaceable metal wear plate and second I own the special notched tool (higher up versions just need two wrenches) to take the spindles out and grease the tiny little balls and races.  This is my biggest positive for Shimano pedals (and their hubs too) is they use cup and cone bearings.  Cartridge bearings are fine (and somewhat serviceable) but cup and cone, infinite adjustment, very old school but it just works.  I like to clean and lube my pedals once a year, probably overkill but I enjoy this sort of thing.  I have a pair that is 15 years old (I lost my first Lance pedals in a move) that I use on my "B" bike and they spin like new so this new pair I expect to last me at least 15 years with maybe replacing the previously mentioned metal wear plate once.

Replace cleats as needed as they are a wear item.  Other than cleats, with a tiny bit of love, expect the pedals to last decades, unlike any other pedal out there.  Probably the most cost efficient part you can put on your bike and the $100 you spend will work out to a few dollars per year of use.
review.name: Shimano pedals far and away the best

name: PD-R550 SPD-SL Pedals

review.reviewBody: Overall, it fits true to size for a medium. Sleeves are way too short and the extra material around the neck is just weird and annoying. For much cheaper, there are more comfortable and better fitting jerseys out there.
review.name: Ok, but not great.

review.reviewBody: Great jersey for warmer days. Probably my favorite fitting jersey
review.name: Go to

review.reviewBody: I like the design of the jersey but it seems to be a bit small for its size compared to two other new Rapha jersey's that I have.  Pretty cool in hot weather. Pocket lay out is.  The zipper is pretty terrible and cheap.  It is very hard to get the zipper started and then takes two hands to move it up or down.  I would not buy this model again because of the zipper.
review.name: Nice but zipper is not good.

review.reviewBody: Jersey is of great quality, but like the other reviewer, it didn’t come close to fitting.  The size chart is way off and I even ordered the next size up due to other reviewers recommendaton.  Fits like a Kids Medium.  Too Bad, returned it pronto…
review.name: Does Not Fit

review.reviewBody: Crazy sizing on this product.  I'm 5'11'' 165#, so not a big guy.  I usually wear a medium shirt.  The large was too small to get on, the XL was just still too tight.  This is not a "relaxed fit" by any stretch of the imagination.
review.name: Order large

name: Core Lightweight Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have these to replace a pair of hurricanes that had holes in the bottom. These are the new and improved model.
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: I love the shoes, but unfortunately, I wore them before realizing they were too big
review.name: Bad sizing

review.reviewBody: These are great! I don't know why I waited so long to get them! The souls are sturdy enough to bike 20 miles in and then I don't even have to take them off when I get in the water. Good grip and super comfortable!
review.name: So multipurpose!

review.reviewBody: I only wear Teva Hurricanes and I like them especially well when they are on sale. Since a 2004 brain injury left me with some left side deficits, these shoes are the only ones in which I can walk so thank the goddess for Teva!
review.name: My go to shoe for all occasions.

review.reviewBody: I loved these sandals but unfortunately after very mild use the soles have fallen off both shoes. My husband and I both have a pair and he complains that the straps take forever to dry once wet. Just expected them to last more than a year and a half. Super disappointing.
review.name: Soles fall off / not quick to dry

review.reviewBody: A much better, more practical sandle than the Original Universal womans =cute but not functional sandle. I ordered the original but tripped on my own feet due to the feeling of flat boards under my feet which have not give. To me not a safe sandle for someone my age 69. The hurricane xlt2 = wayyyyy better. Much safer. I'm much happier with the fit more contured to feel natural. I've had my old tevas 15 years still going strong not sure their name but I love the way they conture to my feet with out any I mean any problems or defects. They are a great company. They let me exchange my original for the hurricane which... moral of the story...are awesome! You will love them if your as lucky and selective as I get outside with something from teva that feels good for you, and you'll both go onward on and on year after year happily on your long journeys. I love my new hurricane tevas!
review.name: Fits great feels safe

review.reviewBody: These sandals are super comfortable and look good with casual wear. I can wear them all day while traveling with no issues. Unfortunately, the sole has fallen off of all three pairs I have owned. My most recent pair lasted a bit more than a year. My husband had the same experience with his pair. We do live at the beach so need to rinse sand of the sandals regularly so I am not sure it that is the issue. But, the sandals are not worn out in any other way and probably would have several more years of life if not for the soles !
review.name: Sole Falls Off

review.reviewBody: I loved these shoes for the few months that I wore them. Bought them last summer and probably got a collective 6 months of occasional wear out of them between this year and last. Today the outsole almost completely detached, and of course the warranty only lasts for one year and they're just barely out of warranty. I'll be switching back to chacos.
review.name: Cute? Yes! Durable? Absolutely not!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! They are so comfortable and supportive. I wear them everywhere!
review.name: I love these sandals

review.reviewBody: I have these in sesame and I wear them with EVERYTHING!!!! They are insanely comfortable and supportive and I actually really love the looks of them! I have the original, flatform and these hurricanes and the hurricanes are by far chosen every time. I just can't seem to NOT wear them! They've been worn walking, running, disc golfing, out to dinner/movies and sight seeing. These are a MUST HAVE
review.name: OBSESSED
