review.reviewBody: I so wanted these slippers.  Love the brand, love the gray, wool color and slipper style.  I am regular foot width.  The toe box on these slippers is so narrow.  I always have slippers on, year round.  During the day I also wear socks with my slippers.  With these scuffs, it was noticeably snug.  So I took off my socks to weigh my decision.  Still super snug.  I really grappled with wanting to make it work but my slippers have to be comfy.  I, unfortunately, had to return.
review.name: Wanted to love these

review.reviewBody: So comfortable!  And I love how sturdy they are!  These are great.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Runs true to size. Outdoor sole is durable to walk to the mailbox and the overall look is sophisticated enough to wear to lunch or the grocery store. Good quality.
review.name: Great Scuffs

review.reviewBody: Love these slippers...So comfy and great arch support
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody: Love! Lightweight sole while still being protective. Very snug fit with fur above and on footbed. However, removeable insole is a big plus to allow for wear in warmer weather too. Flexible upper bends with you.
review.name: Love lightweight, flexible, removeable insole

review.reviewBody: Great fitting, super comfy slippers. They are warm and look great.
review.name: Best slippers

review.reviewBody: Amazing. The overall structure and integrity of this shoe is great, while being cushy and comfortable. Doesn't feel like a slipper. Feels like a good runaround shoe. Yet, it's cushy, warm and cozy like slippers. Love these!!!!
review.name: Wow! The ultimate cozy shoe with good support.

review.reviewBody:
I love my new Sorel Nakiska slippers. I'm a die hard UGG's fan - and these are better than the UGG Perle or Scuffette slippers and this is why. The Nakiska has more cushion and it has arch support that's not too stiff. The slippers are lightweight and almost feel like clouds on your feet. The bottoms are grippy so they are great for running outside or on wood/tile floors. Your heel is cupped in so they stay on.  I normally wear an 8½ shoe (sometimes 9 in a sneaker) and a 9 was perfect in this slipper. 

I've had 6 foot surgeries on my right foot and have a hard time finding anything comfortable. I put these slippers on and wore them all day. Happy feet ❤️.
review.name: I'm an UGG's Convert

review.reviewBody: this is the second pair I have bought.  The first ones were bought several years ago and they are still in good shape.  I like these slippers because they do not have a high sole but the soles are sturdy.  They are also very comfortable and true to size.
review.name: Great slippers

review.reviewBody: The only slippers I will wear. I love them! You won't be disappointed.
review.name: The best!

review.reviewBody: Love this shirt.  It’s so heavyweight and so soft that it’s warm, comfortable, and (I assume) durable.  I have work it a LOT (probably at least 10 days) in the month since it arrived, and love it as much as in the day it arrived.  I’m 6’0 165 lbs and the medium is perfect for a work/comfort shirt.
review.name: New favorite flannel!

review.reviewBody: I like it all thanks
review.name: Great material!

review.reviewBody: I'm usually in between a small and medium (6'1", 170 lbs) and decided on a medium. Glad I did--fits like a true smedium-tall. Good midweight flannel for these summer Alaska days.
review.name: Great fit, looks sharp

review.reviewBody: What's there to say about this flannel other than its nothing short of perfect in every way. Form, fit, and function all describe the traits of this flannel. I have never owned a flannel like this ever and i now have two that i rotate constantly. I get loads of compliments about its look as well as feel of the shirt. Cannot recommend enough!!!
review.name: A staple in my wardrobe

review.reviewBody: I liked it so much I bought a second and will add more in the future. Warm, soft, good fit and durable.
review.name: Great shirt

review.reviewBody: Really nice comfortable shirt well made very nice colors also
review.name: Great looking shirt

review.reviewBody: The shirt itself is great and really comfortable, is a go to in my closet. But, I have had to re-sew everyone of the main buttons and one of the sleeve buttons back on. nothing like having buttons fall off during a walk/hike or sitting around the house from what is supposed to be a top gear manufacturer. Frustrating!
review.name: Poor quality assembly

review.reviewBody: One of the softest flannel shirts I own. Looks good, fits great (6' 2", 160 lb) and is an all around shirt. Not too heavy and not on the thin side - it's spot on. Easy to dress up or wear it casually. I am thinking about getting another before winter comes back around.
review.name: Excellent Flannel by OR

review.reviewBody: This is a great shirt, except the sizing I'd really big. Very soft, warm, and comfortable. But, I am 6' 190lbs and the large is extremely loose and baggy. I still wear it but only over a hoody to fill the space n
review.name: Really big

review.reviewBody: I wear this shirt when I'm out fly fishing and then wear it to my office. It has a nice cut that is both formal enough for my work environment and comfortable enough to wear in the field all day.
review.name: Great shirt!

review.reviewBody: Great fit, support and comfort! Tackles everything from trail to yard work.
review.name: Evolv Rebel Approach

review.reviewBody: I thought at first they were a bit tight, but lengthwise they are perfect and they molded to my width a bit - but they are tight so I can't wear them all day. I do use these as approach and have found them to be very much confidence inspiring - great grip, because they are tight around my foot they provide good stability, and they are stiff - but they are also a big bulkier than other approach shoes I've owned. Considering buying a second pair in another color.
review.name: Love...once I switched to black laces

review.reviewBody:
This shoe is hella comfortable and good looking (other than the white laces which should be black). HOWEVER-- backcountry sizing is incorrect. I always order by EU sizing (EU 40)-- according to backcountry size guide this would equate to a size 9. In actuality, the shoes I rec'd were an EU 41. SO-- I bought another pair in size 8.5, but I now have rec'd a size 9.5. Something is going on with sizing at backcountry. Be sure you check the Evolv website for correct sizing. 

Unfortunately, the 8.5 is now sold out so I'm left with two shoes that are too big. Oh well! I ordered from Evolv website instead. I plan on wearing these as a true approach shoe, and I'm looking forward to it.
review.name: Great shoe; wrong sizing on Backcountry

review.reviewBody:
I bought a few pairs of approach shoes to try as I'm looking for something that will be sticky, yet supportive enough to wear while lugging a heavy pack full of trad gear for a mile or more. 

I tried a pair of the tan (latte) in my usual street size. They fit true to size, felt initially comfortable and supportive (the insole has some arch support), and I love them aesthetically. (Except black laces instead of white would have been better.) Love that they're vegan. The uppers seemed durable. About the same stickiness I've had in other approach shoes.

Most retailers carrying this shoe didn't have any user reviews yet, but I did notice that that Evolv website describes this shoe as much more casual and more for streetwear than for outdoor crags. Outdoor Gear Lab also had some good insights from testing the men's version, which was mostly that they weren't great for hiking, which is a huge need for me.

I was tempted to keep them just as a casual street shoe and as an option for short approaches, but, you know, money and priorities. So based on the additional information I found on other sites, I'm returning these and trying some La Sportivas next.
review.name: GREAT Style, not the function for me

name: Rebel Approach Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Aeroe Spider Rear Rack + Cradle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Spider Rear Rack + Cradle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Aeroe Spider Rear Rack + Cradle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Aeroe Rack + Cradle for the Colorado trail.  It is supposed to work with a full suspension mountain bike and dropper, which would be a great combination.  Unfortunately, the cradle is poorly designed -- the single point of contact is the downfall.  When I tightened to spec, the bolts worked their way through the plastic cradle (there is no metal to reinforce) and the bag + cradle came off my bike during a rocky descent.  The only way to fix the issue was to use multiple voile straps to attache the cradle to the rack and my seatpost.  It was a nightmare.  Don't waste your money on this -- my rack is going straight to the trash.
review.name: Awful Rack

review.reviewBody: Easy on, easy off and very sturdy. I use the top handle to carry the bike up and down the steps at the office. It's pricey for a rack but well worth the money. Instead of buying the Aero bags which are pricey for their size IMO, I got Sea To Summit Big River dry bags and they work much better and cheaper and come in various sizes for your different trips.
review.name: Perfect rack for avid bikepackers

review.reviewBody:
Using this with FS Scott Spark - only a couple of days so far but very happy. Easy install, allows me to use dropper and is very stable. I rotated the cradle so I can put the bag perpendicularly to the rear wheel - otherwise I don't think I would be able to use the dropper as much (150mm). Even in this orientation I can't get much behind the saddle so can't descend too aggressively but that is fine, with a loaded bike the handling is different anyway.

I only have one cradle but thinking about  either adding bottle holders to the side for extra H2O storage or maybe another cradle in the future, if I need more capacity.
review.name: Great solution for FS bikes

review.reviewBody: These are great and you can use them on a full suspension mountain bike which is great.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Great product - Stable and Easy to Use. Have 2 of these for my hardtail MTB and my wife's Fully suspension EMTB. Work very well on both. Quick to install, Easy to use, quality construction and super stable with no sway on rough rides. Highly recommend, 5 star.
review.name: Great product - Stable and Easy to Use

name: Spider Rear Rack + Cradle

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Terrible quality, two pairs both used only a few times before the sides became unglued where the upper literally meets the sole.   How can this be? These shoes are not cheap but the manufacturing is preposterous.  Impossible to fix! 
Merrell how can you’ve go down so much in quality!
review.name: Shoes come apart after few uses— 2 pairs same prob

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable but then this is my third pair so it’s no surprise. And I’ve got several other styles of Merrell footwear.
review.name: Repeat customer
comment: Your feedback fuels our journey!

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is an excellent quality shoe that has phenomenal grip for snow/ice.  Very please.
review.name: Highly recommend.
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are amazing! They are very helpful for managing Raynaud’s in shoulder season when boots would look out of place
review.name: Great insulated option that isn’t a boot

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These mocs are like snow tires for your feet.  The deep, grippy treads are ideal for slippery conditions.  Sadly, I found them to be between half and one whole size too small (in 5W), and also slightly narrow even in the wide width.
review.name: Nice but need to size up

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these slip on shoes. Very warm. Really supportive.
review.name: My work shoes

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the second awesome pair that I have purchased
review.name: Perfect winter show
comment: Thank you for the great feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Just as comfortable as my regular Merrell Mocs but with much better traction!
review.name: Great travel shoes

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wanted a waterproof slip on for taking my dog out - I live in rural PNW, so walking means a lot of grass, fields, dirt roads, and rocky beaches in constant rain. These not only keep my feet dry, but they're comfortable, and have great traction even on the wet slippery rocks at the beach. They fit true to size, however, if you plan on wearing big wool socks, I would size up a half size.
review.name: Just what I was looking for

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Nice quality, seem to be waterproof.  Only been in the wet for a short bit.  
A word of WARNING!!!!!!..The artic grip on the soles left marks on my hardwood floors that will not come off.  It leaves the exact shape of the artic grip designs on sole.  Some marks rubbed off  with some effort.  Others won't.  I was wearing them around the house to see how they fit.  I bought these for the shop so will keep, but won't wear them in the house.
review.name: A word of warning!

name: Coldpack 3 Thermo Moc WP Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had a smith vantage for years.  They are good helmets.  But the sizing is off now.  I currently own a Smith Vantage in L.  I just tried a Smith Vantage Round contour and it is tighter than the regular vantage.  This is despite the measurement guide saying it is a good bit bigger.  So, if you’re thinking the round contour and the larger internal size is going to be a better fit…it won’t be.  
I am also not thrilled by how high these new helmets sit.  They have a very large profile. 
I’m sure it’s a great helmet.  It just doesn’t fit my head right.
review.name: Sizes are off

review.reviewBody: I have a Smith Method Round fit, size M, and it fits me perfectly. But for Vantage size M is totally too small for me. It's too tight even after loose the BOA. I have measured that I have 58 cm for the head, but I still feel too tight on the side of Vantage. M is 59-63cm, there is no way I should buy a 63-67cm helmet (Size L) for my head.
review.name: Size too small compare with other Smith Method round fit helmet

review.reviewBody: Used this helmet a few times now.  Super comfy for all day wear, and the ability to close the vents is super cool on wet days and warm sunny days.  I was originally worried about the brim being an issue with goggle fit and fogging, but I’ve nothing but good experiences.
review.name: Comfy and airy

review.reviewBody: Helmet fits great, super comfortable and adjustable. Have worn it in very cold to spring skiing like conditions with this crazy winter in NE. Only gripe is the material of the ear pieces is heavier and a bit coarse. other than that, couldn't be happier with my purchase.
review.name: Solid Helmet

review.reviewBody: Very good product. Light weight and fit perfectly right out of the box. Adjust chin strap, clip it and go! Priced right too!
review.name: Very good product. Light weight

review.reviewBody: Love this helmet! It runs a little small. I’m normally a medium and got a large.
review.name: Love this helmet! It runs

review.reviewBody: The fit is comfortable and the helmet is lighter than my previous helmet.
review.name: The fit is comfortable and

review.reviewBody: I have the same helmet but like the website says this "shape fits differently" and I lost out buying a for sale helmet which isn't ideal for my head. Oh well.
review.name: I have the same helmet

review.reviewBody: Smashed the back of my head into a tree and the helmet worked perfectly! So I bought another one, feels snug but barely notice you're wearing it.
review.name: Works as advertised

review.reviewBody: This helmet is solid. It fits well, it’s almost a touch small but still fits perfectly. All the features and adjustments are simple to use. I would recommend this helmet.
review.name: Quality Helmet

name: Vantage Round Contour Fit Helmet

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this bag! I wanted a work bag that could transition from tote to backpack and this fit the brief perfectly. I love that the tote and backpack straps can be tucked away so that they're not getting dragged on the ground when not in use. It's a touch small, but that just means that I can't over stuff it and it's never too heavy. I have managed to fit two laptops, an iPad, a notebook and a pencil case with room to spare though :)
review.name: I love this bag! I

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As versatile and secure and fashionable and sturdy as I had hoped. Very good quality.
review.name: As versatile and secure and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fantastic backpack. I work in the Adventure travel industry and have taken this bag on several international trips which involve tons of networking, meetings, and running from place to place. This bag comfortably carried my ipad, a sweater, my giant yeti waterbottle (I also miss the waterbottle pockets on bags but the front pocket where the straps hide worked great), billions of business cards, my 'mess kit' for flying, and snacks, always snacks. I'm really stoked to finally have a bag thats small enough it's comfortable but big enough to carry what I need. Only complaint so far is the straps seem a bit wide. As in, they are sewed wide on the bag so they sit on my outer shoulder if that makes sense. Didnt seem to be an issue and I got used to it but there were points early on when I kept like I needed to 'pull the bag' up on my shoulders, especially when it was full.
review.name: Fantastic backpack. I work in

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my Arcane tote-pack. It’s attractive, comfortable, ever so spacious, easy to carry, and reasonably priced. The long handles, which can be hidden away, make the bag easy to transport. The tech panel is useful. 

I really enjoy using this bag. I can suggest some improvements, however. 

I took off one star for the absence of a water bottle holder and the absence of a sternum or waist strap. 

Other bags in the Arcane series do feature a water bottle holder, so why is it absent on this bag? 

When I am carrying a heavy load and bend over, I find that the pack folds forward over my head! A sternum strap or waist strap might correct that. 

I also find that it is difficult to unhook the shoulder straps from their attachment to the bottom of the bag. Perhaps the attachment loops could be made a bit larger.

Somehow I love this bag so much that none of these issues are deal breakers.
review.name: I love my Arcane tote-pack.

review.reviewBody:
I am 5'3" and it's difficult to find a backpack that is the right height, with shoulder straps not too widely set. I also had a list of "must have"s and "want to have"s. I ordered Arcane Tote Pack, Arcane Large Daypack, and Daylite Tote Pack, all 20L capacity.
Arcane Tote Pack is my favorite: it does not check all the boxes (no water bottle holder, no chest strap), and is a bit heavier than I wanted, but the trade off is that it has some structure so it will maintain the shape when not full, and the padded back and shoulder straps are very comfortable to wear. I can use the front stash pocket for water bottles, and I won't need a chest strap. Mine is brindle color with blue/lavender straps, and it looks classy and appropriate as a business bag. 
Arcane Large Daypack is supposed to be shorter in height than this Arcane Totepack because Totepack has fold-down design. However, Arcane Totepack's back panel is shorter by about an inch, and that extra inch made a lot of difference in terms of comfort because Arcane Large Daypack extend down to my tailbone and it didn't feel comfortable. If not for that, I like the simplicity and elegant design of this bag very much. If you have a longer torso than I do, this won't be a problem. 
Daylite Totepack checks all my boxes, is comfortable, and lighter than Arcane. I am deciding to keep both because I like the look of Arcane better for everyday business and  Daylite will come in handy for travel. 
FYI, tote bag straps are about the same length in Daylite and Arcane - a bit short for wearing over the shoulder, but if longer, it would be awkward to carry by hand- , but straps on Acrane is a bit more comfortable because of the design and fabric.
This was my first order with Backcountry, and I am impressed by price, great selections, and how quickly bags were sent.
review.name: well-made, comfortable, classy look

review.reviewBody: This is great for a weekend trip. Fit my clothes and toiletries for 3 days. Very comfortable wearing it at the airport and around town till I could check in at a hotel. Love how you can switch to the tote handles. The structure components for your back give great support. Canvas like texture that stays clean. Very happy with this!
review.name: Great for a weekend trip

name: Arcane 20L Tote Pack
